page.title: 07RIDING STABLES,HAWLEY.
page.content: Hawley Equitation Centre was built in the early{1800s}and was first used as a cavalry stables.The owner does not breed his own horses,he buys them from a number of sources.At present there are {45}horses and ponies here,some are used for riding lessons and others are livery horses.The horses work here until they reach the age of {20}. Nine people work at the stables,{4}are instructors who live in mobile homes,and {5} are trainees who work for free whilst they are being trained as instructors.The horses food is kept in metal containers so that rats,the damp,and wandering horses don't get at it.There is a chart that tells how much each horse should eat.The horses are also fed on straw.They are given one bucket of water during the day and two at night.Most of the ponies are put out to grass at night.
